reqs: Develop and validate algorithms to approach the GCOS ECV and meet the wider requirements of the Climate Community (i.e. long term, consistent, stable, uncertainty-characterized) global satellite data products from multi- sensor data archives. [CR-1]
Produce, validate and deliver consistent time series of multi-sensor global satellite ECV data products for climate science. [CR-2]

The Permafrost_cci system shall be able to generate different products:
1.    GTD, when the parameter is ground temperature at a certain depth
2.    ALT, if the parameter is active layer thickness
3.    PFR if the parameter is permafrost extent (fraction)
4.    PFF if the parameter is permafrost-free fraction
5.    PFT if the parameter is fraction underlain by talik
6.    PZO if the parameter is permafrost zone
Generate and fully document a production system capable of processing and reprocessing the data, with the aim of supporting transfer to operational activities outside CCI (such as C3S). [CR-4]
All project documentation shall be made publicly available via the CCI Open Data Portal.\
The PS shall capitalise on existing European assets through their reuse, particularly Open Source scientific tools and prototype ECV processing systems from prior projects. (heritage)

The global Permafrost community shall play an active role in its creation according to given guidelines and advice from a strategic operations team. They shall also give feedback from the implementation to the strategic team.
The system shall implement a data production line that is sufficiently flexible to continuously update and extend the database (e.g. with data from new sensors or better acquisitions).
The available data shall be frequently reported and properly disseminated to the interested user communities.
Minimum maintenance and cost
The Products shall be uniquely identified.
The PS shall store data in a structured way using type, revision, date.
If input data is retrieved directly from a third party ground segment, the PS has to ensure that links are maintained and functionality is regularly checked.
The PS shall be able to reprocess also parts of the products.
The PS shall be able to do partial processing.
The PS shall be flexible in form of delivery for maps and data.
The PS shall include proper Product Description
The PS shall be able to do long time series processing in due time.
The PS shall be able to do reprocessing in due time.
The PS shall be able to run on the available hardware infrastructure
The PS shall have sufficient space for output data
The PS shall have sufficient space for auxiliary data
The PS shall have sufficient space for input data
The PS shall have the capability and interfaces to extend for future adaptations.
The PS shall have or use a long-term storage for its products
The PS shall have a self-standing documentation
Development of the PS shall be under version control.
The system should be decoupled from the research
Development of the system shall be based on the user requirements, the selected algorithms and the validation protocols used to generate the baseline products for the worldwide glacier inventory.
The PS development shall be overseen by a science team that drives the development process.
Each PS installation includes a set of test tools, data and benchmark data to test PS integrity (end-to-end, interfaces)
If a module is based on a prototype, the prototype state has to be frozen until it is implemented.
The verification is regarded as successful, when all tests agree within TBD limits. Hashes are to be preferred where applicable.
The operational processor shall not overwrite existing data. Versioning shall be used instead.

The system developed shall be detailed as a separate self-standing document providing an overview of the system and its components, functionality of the system and its subsystems, inputs, outputs, resource key interfaces, and resource requirements.
Verification of the correct implementation of the prototype system against the algorithms developed in Task 2 is a fundamental part of the process.
The verification shall be documented in a Verification Report. It shall contain the chosen approach and the justification, the selected verification data set and the verification results.
The PS shall provide means against data loss of its input / output products.
All data stored in the system shall be available for the long-term (at least 15 years).
